  • ABOUT

My background in visual arts, front-end development and interaction design has allowed me to have a multifaceted perspective and appreciation for my work in UX/UI design.

As a positive, inquisitive and self-driven designer I'm passionate about all things design. Some of my recent activities include:

  • Learning Figma (a trending design tool) and migrating my design work to this platform.
  • Developing and advocating the use of a design system.
  • Completing a Neilson Norman Group UX course on “Emerging Patterns in Interface Design”.
  • Creating animations in Principle for a product launch.

I'm also a believer of giving back by promoting social good, volunteering my time and skills to non profits and design education. Recently, I have been volunteering my time to help with the online presence of the Rett Syndrome Society of British Columbia.

Havng over 12 years of experience working in the tech industry has enabled me to acquire the technical and soft skills required to execute and collaborate with successful outcomes. I've had the pleasure to design for Samsung, Public Health Agency of Canada, British Columbia's Institute of Technology, Goa Games (a gaming subsidiary of Orange), and many small businesses.

Empathy

Understanding users needs and goals help me to make informed design decisions.

Simplicity

Keeping the user journey clear and simple helps users complete the intended task.

Intuition

Intuitive design affords the user an enjoyable and frictionless experience.

When I am offline, you can find me spending time with my wife and daughter, going on bike rides, crushing a bowl of ramen, or watching Formula 1.

Feel free to reach out to me with any inquiries about design work.
